moves.6... e5 7. Nb3 Be6 8. Qd2 Be7 9. f3 O-O: Every move so far following theory.
moves.14. Ng3: This move, according to the gameknot database, isn't the best option. 54.6% score for black.. pretty darn good. The idea is to get the knight to f5, but if one move is played incorrectly, the game is lost for white. The position is too sharp for any errors!
moves.14... a5 15. Kb1 a4 16. Nc1 Nc7: Usually black plays 16.. b3, but this move is also good, certainly better against me! - moving in his knight for the attack.
moves.17. f4 exf4 18. Bxf4 Nc5 19. Qxb4: DEFINATELY too risky for me to take this pawn. Looking back at the game, this move is definately where I lost it. Opening the B-file led to a crushing attack for black.
moves.19... Rb8 20. Qc3 Rb6 21. Rg1 g6: Stopping any quick attacks of my own
moves.22. Ka1: Trying to keep off the nasty B-file!
moves.22... Qa8 23. Nd3 Nb3+:
A stunning elegant move that caught me offguard! If I capture with axb3, the opening of the a-file with check leads to my downfall.

Much more subtly, after 24. cxb3 axb3 I am in some trouble.. 
For example, 25. a3 loses promptly to 25.. Nb5 26. Qc1 Rc8 where I can't stop the deadly threat of Nxa3.
25. Nb4 d5 is crushing as well.
Better was Qxf3, but i was too worried about black's attack
